item.title: Golang Structured Logging w/ Google Cloud Logging (2)
item.description: Recently, I described how to configure Golang logging so that user-defined key-values applied to the logs are parsed when ingested by Google Cloud Logging. Cloud Logging log entries incorporating user-defined labels (see dog:freddie and foo:bar) and a readily-querable jsonPayload: insertId: 616dbf8e000892de40c4cc4e jsonPayload: level: 0 logger: MyName msg: something ts: '2021-10-18 00:00:00.000000' labels: dog: freddie foo: bar instanceId: 00bf4bf0... logName: projects/.../logs/run.googleapis.com%2Fstdout receiveTimestamp: '2021-10-18T00:00:00.000000000Z' resource: labels: configuration_name: structured-logging location: us-west2 project_id: ... revision_name: .
